newsitem.title: FRANCE: SIA ex-Paris cargo capacity to rise 16 pct.
newsitem.headline: SIA ex-Paris cargo capacity to rise 16 pct.

text.p: Singapore Airlines (SIA) said its decision to upgrade Paris-Singapore passenger services later this month will create around 16 pct more cargo capacity on the route.
From October 27, SIA plans to operate daily, non-stop Paris-Singapore flights with Airbus Industrie 340-300E aircraft compared to five weekly flights currently with Boeing 747-400 aircraft.

"At present, our 747-400 Paris-Singapore passenger service is linked to Brussels, Amsterdam, Madrid and Manchester," SIA's regional cargo manager, Europe, W.K. Lim, told Reuters in a telephone interview from London.
"With the service being upgraded to non-stop and a daily frequency, cargo capacity on these flights from Charles de Gaulle airport will increase by 16 percent on current levels," he added.
The A340 and the B747-400 have a similar cargo capacity and offer around 15 tonnes of airfreight per flight.

Paris was one of SIA's key cargo hubs in western Europe with the airline exporting commodities such as car components, aviation equipment, helicopter parts, chemicals, wines and spirits, clothing and foodstuffs, through the CDG gateway, Lim said.
Apart from passenger services, SIA operates a three times a week 747 freighter service between Paris and Singapore in partership with Air France.

The French state airline has already said it will introduce an additional Boeing 747 freighter carrying -- around 100 tonnes -- on the route later this month as a result of strong market demand. --Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44 171 542 8982 Fax +44 171 542 5017
